title: What proportion of older people can access a reablement service?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of older people (over 65) discharged from a hospital episode who were offered a reablement or rehabilitation service has varied little over time. However there has been a small increase from 2.97% in 2010/11 to 3.33% in 2013/14. Although not shown here there has been a rise in the total number of older people discharged (and therefore eligible for these services) since 2010/11 and the number of people being offered a reablement/rehabilitaion service has risen with this. In 2010/11, roughly 36,600 people were offered a service compared to around 44,700 in 2013/14.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care - Combined Activity Return (ASC-CAR)
